description: Sunflower seeds are an excellent source of many vital nutrients including Vitamin E, also known as gamma-tocopherol.

Vitamin E is a powerful antioxidant that is found in many nuts and seeds, but sunflower seeds are one of the best natural sources of this antioxidant, which works hard to fight free radical damage within the body.
A ¼ cup serving of sunflower seeds provides 190 calories, 16 grams of fat, 6 grams of protein, and 4 grams of fiber.
Sunflower seeds are rich in antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds which lower oxidative stress and the presence of damaging free-radicals within the body.
Vitamin E antioxidants are found in cholesterol particles and help to prevent free radicals from dangerously oxidizing cholesterol.
Sunflower seeds also contain selenium, an antioxidant that is important for preventing breast cancer.
name: Sunflower seeds

Helps to Prevent Cancer Due to High Antioxidant Content.
Sunflower seeds contain high levels of phosphorous, which when consumed excessively, can impact kidney function.
Help To Promote Hair Growth And Luster.
Reduces oxidative stress and neutralizes the effects that free radicals can have on the body.
